title: Is game stability dependent on where people are playing from?
body:
Let's say 10 people are to play a match and all 10 people are living near Chicago. The game would be be played at a stable FPS and Ping, correct? 

Compared to 10 people in which one person is playing near Chicago and 3 are playing from Europe and 1 person playing from Asia, etc. Would the game be laggy for the person playing near Chicago because the server is compensating/handling connections from that far?


Also, for example, if a person has Overwatch, 50 Chrome tabs with YouTube videos loading, PBE Client open while in a game of League of Legends (live), would that affect game stability for the other 9 people in the game?

replies.body:
The locations of the different players in a match shouldn't affect the stability for any of the other users as far as Ping/FPS is concerned. If one of them has a really bad connection, it would only effect that one player. 

On the same note, if you have all of that running at once, you're bound to have a bad time in the match xD. But, nobody else would be affected by that one player having everything running in the background.
